articles.title: Using the GNRD API to find taxonomic names
articles.description: A Global Names Architecture adventure supported by R package Taxize
articles.contents:
A notebook to learn how to use the GNRD API
Via Global Names Architecture at: https://globalnames.org/apps/ “Global Names Recognition and Discovery: a name discovery service that accepts Microsoft Office documents, PDFs, images, and other files, performs OCR as required, then uses TaxonFinder and NetiNeti name discovery algorithms. It has several configuration options including passing found names to Global Names Resolver.”
Our use case is text-mining the Proceedings of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia (ANSP) to identify species names. This is a first-step toward then identifying species occurrences (species observation + date + location). We know that Global Names can find taxonomic names in ANSP because every page of items in the Biodiversity Heritage Library has taxonomic names listed that were identified using GN. Eg., https://www.biodiversitylibrary.org/page/1694302#page/211/mode/1up (bottom left). So, the exercise here is to learn how to use the API, get it working on our corpus, and get comforatble working with the content.
Amanda Whitmire : thalassa@stanford.edu; https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2429-8879; @AWhitTwit


# install.packages("taxize") 



Load the Libraries we need.


library(rbhl)
library(tidyverse)
library(rmarkdown)
library(knitr)
library(distill)
library(taxize)



From https://rdrr.io/cran/taxize/man/scrapenames.html, we have:


taxa <- scrapenames(
  url = 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animalia', # a web page with taxa mentioned
  engine = 0, # uses both name finding engines (IDK what the differences are, tbh)
  unique = TRUE, # just show the unique names as a start
  verbatim = FALSE, # default
  detect_language = TRUE, # default
  with_verification = TRUE, # can't seem to get this to work
  all_data_sources = TRUE,
  return_content = FALSE
)



This returns a list of length 2, with a list of metadata (search query settings) and results (data). Let’s look!


taxa[["meta"]]


$token_url
[1] "http://gnrd.globalnames.org/name_finder.json?token=3acehplu68"

$input_url
[1] "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animalia"

$file
NULL

$status
[1] 200

$engine
[1] "gnfinder"

$unique
[1] TRUE

$verbatim
[1] FALSE

$parameters
$parameters$return_content
[1] FALSE

$parameters$with_verification
[1] FALSE

$parameters$preferred_data_sources
list()

$parameters$detect_language
[1] FALSE

$parameters$engine
[1] 0

$parameters$no_bayes
[1] FALSE


$language_used
[1] "eng"

$execution_time
$execution_time$text_preparation_duration
[1] 2.779913

$execution_time$find_names_duration
[1] 0.06001306

$execution_time$total_duration
[1] 2.844456


$total
[1] 272



max_len <- max(lengths(taxa[["data"]]))
df <- do.call(cbind.data.frame, c(lapply(taxa[["data"]], function(x) 
               c(x, rep('', max_len - length(x)))), stringsAsFactors = FALSE))
knitr::kable(df)
